result.execSummary:
The defendant Fernando J. Zamora was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Counseling shall specifically include:  AODA Assessment and follow through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

timeConds.notes: AS A CONDITION TO PROBATION - AS AN ALTERNATIVE TO REVOCATION -  No Huber  -  No good time  -  Credit since the 1-25-18 order to detain

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney R DeFilippis.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 2 years w/condiitons; credit for 39 days served if revoked; deft to pay $250 DNA surcharge; bond applied to costs, any remainder of bond to be returned to poster.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney R DeFilippis.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI ordered.  DNA sample ordered.  SEH 4/4/16 at 1:30pm.  Bond continued.
